00031 class Effect;

00033 
00034 #define PLUGIN_EFFECT   0x0001
00035 #define BUILTIN_EFFECT  0x0002
00036 // ADVANCED_EFFECT was introduced for Lynn Allan's 'CleanSpeech'
00037 // it allows the list of effects to be filtered to exclude
00038 // the advanced effects.
00039 #define ADVANCED_EFFECT 0x0004
00040 // HIDDEN_EFFECT allows an item to be excluded from the effects
00041 // menu in both CleanSpeech and in normal builds.
00042 #define HIDDEN_EFFECT   0x0008
00043 
00044 #define INSERT_EFFECT   0x0010
00045 #define PROCESS_EFFECT  0x0020
00046 #define ANALYZE_EFFECT  0x0040
00047 #define ALL_EFFECTS     0x00FF
00048 
00049 // Flag used to disable prompting for configuration
00050 // parameteres.
00051 #define CONFIGURED_EFFECT 0x8000
00052 
00053 //CLEAN-ME: Rogue value to skip unwanted effects in a chain.
00054 //lda: SKIP_EFFECT_MILLISECOND is a rogue value, used where a millisecond
00055 //time is required to indicate "Don't do this effect".
00056 //It is used in SpikeCleaner and TruncSilence.
00057 //MERGE: Maybe we can remove this now that we have configurable batch
00058 //and so can just drop the steps we don't want?
00059 #define SKIP_EFFECT_MILLISECOND 99999
00060 
00061 class Effect {
00062    
00063  // 
00064  // public methods
00065  //
00066  // Used by the outside program to determine properties of an effect and
00067  // apply the effect to one or more tracks.
00068  // 
00069  public:
00070    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method.
00071    // This name will go in the menu bar;
00072    // append "..." if your effect pops up a dialog
00073    virtual wxString GetEffectName() = 0;
00074 
00075    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method.
00076    // This should return the category of this effect, which
00077    // will determine where in the menu it's placed.
00078 #ifdef EFFECT_CATEGORIES
00079    virtual std::set<wxString> GetEffectCategories() = 0;
00080 #endif
00081 
00082    // Totally optional - if you need a way to identify your effect
00083    // from somewhere else in the program.  This should be human-readable,
00084    // but should NOT be translated.  Use wxT(""), not _("").
00085    virtual wxString GetEffectIdentifier() { return wxT(""); }
00086    
00087    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method.
00088    // This name will go in the progress dialog, but can be used
00089    // elsewhere, and it should describe what is being done.
00090    // For example, if the effect is "Filter", the action is
00091    // "Filtering", or if the effect is "Bass Boost", the action
00092    // is "Boosting Bass Frequencies".
00093    virtual wxString GetEffectAction() = 0;
00094 
00095    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method. 
00096    // This description will go in the History state. 
00097    // Override to include effect parameters, so typically useful only after PromptUser. 
00098    virtual wxString GetEffectDescription() { 
00099       // Default provides effect name. 
00100       return wxString::Format(_("Applied effect: %s"), 
00101                               this->GetEffectName().c_str()); 
00102    } 
00103     
00104    // Return flags which tell you what kind of effect this is.
00105    // It will be either a built-in or a plug-in effect, and it
00106    // will be one of Insert, Process, or Analyze.
00107    virtual int GetEffectFlags() {
00108       // Default of BUILTIN_EFFECT | PROCESS_EFFECT | ADVANCED_EFFECT (set in constructor) - 
00109       // covers most built-in effects.
00110       return mFlags;
00111    }
00112    virtual bool TransferParameters( Shuttle & shuttle ){
00113       return true;
00114    }
00115 
00116    void SetEffectFlags( int NewFlags )
00117    {
00118       mFlags = NewFlags;
00119    }
00120 
00121    // The Effect class fully implements the Preview method for you.
00122    // Only override it if you need to do preprocessing or cleanup.
00123    virtual void Preview();
00124 
00125    // Get an unique ID assigned to each registered effect.
00126    // The first effect will have ID zero.
00127    int GetID() {
00128       return mID;
00129    }
00130 
00131    // Returns true on success.  Will only operate on tracks that
00132    // have the "selected" flag set to true, which is consistent with
00133    // Audacity's standard UI.
00134    bool DoEffect(wxWindow *parent, int flags, double projectRate, TrackList *list,
00135                  TrackFactory *factory, double *t0, double *t1);
00136 
00137    wxString GetPreviewName();
00138 
00139    // Strip ampersand ('&' char) from string. This effectively removes the
00140    // shortcut from the string ('E&qualizer' becomes 'Equalizer'). This is
00141    // important for sorting.
00142    static wxString StripAmpersand(const wxString& str);
00143 
00144    void HandleLinkedTracksOnGenerate(double length, double t0);
00145    bool HandleGroupChangeSpeed(double m_PercentChange, double mCurT0, double mCurT1);
00146  //
00147  // protected virtual methods
00148  //
00149  // Each subclass of Effect overrides one or more of these methods to
00150  // do its processing.
00151  //
00152  protected:
00153    // The constructor.  Called once at the beginning of the program.
00154    // Avoid allocating memory or doing time-consuming processing here.
00155    Effect();
00156 
00157    //The destructor.
00158    virtual ~Effect() {}
00159  
00160    // Called once each time an effect is called.  Perform any initialization;
00161    // make sure that the effect can be performed on the selected tracks and
00162    // return false otherwise
00163    virtual bool Init() {
00164       return true;
00165    }
00166 
00167    // If necessary, open a dialog to get parameters from the user.
00168    // This method will not always be called (for example if a user
00169    // repeats an effect) but if it is called, it will be called
00170    // after Init.
00171    virtual bool PromptUser() {
00172       return true;
00173    }
00174    // Check whether effect should be skipped
00175    // Typically this is only useful in automation, for example
00176    // detecting that zero noise reduction is to be done,
00177    // or that normalisation is being done without Dc bias shift 
00178    // or amplitude modification
00179    virtual bool CheckWhetherSkipEffect() { return false; }
00180       
00181    // Actually do the effect here.
00182    virtual bool Process() = 0;
00183 
00184    // clean up any temporary memory
00185    virtual void End() {
00186    }
00187 
00188 
00189  //
00190  // protected data
00191  //
00192  // The Effect base class will set these variables, some or all of which
00193  // may be needed by any particular subclass of Effect.
00194  //
00195  protected:
00196    wxWindow       *mParent;
00197    ProgressDialog *mProgress;
00198    double         mProjectRate; // Sample rate of the project - new tracks should
00199                                // be created with this rate...
00200    TrackFactory   *mFactory;
00201    TrackList      *mTracks;      // the complete list of all tracks
00202    TrackList      *mWaveTracks;  // effects which do not add or remove tracks
00203                                // should use this
00204    TrackList*     mOutputWaveTracks; // used only if CopyInputWaveTracks() is called.
00205    double         mT0;
00206    double         mT1;
00207 
00208  //
00209  // protected methods
00210  //
00211  // These methods can be used by subclasses of Effect in order to display a
00212  // progress dialog or perform common calculations
00213  //
00214  protected:
00215    // The Progress methods all return true if the user has cancelled;
00216    // you should exit immediately if this happens (cleaning up memory
00217    // is okay, but don't try to undo).
00218  
00219    // Pass a fraction between 0.0 and 1.0
00220    bool TotalProgress(double frac);
00221    
00222    // Pass a fraction between 0.0 and 1.0, for the current track
00223    // (when doing one track at a time)
00224    bool TrackProgress(int whichTrack, double frac);
00225  
00226    // Pass a fraction between 0.0 and 1.0, for the current track group
00227    // (when doing stereo groups at a time)
00228    bool TrackGroupProgress(int whichGroup, double frac);
00229 
00230    int GetNumWaveTracks() { return mNumTracks; }
00231 
00232  //
00233  // protected static data
00234  //
00235  // Preferences shared by all effects
00236  //
00237  protected:
00238    static double sDefaultGenerateLen;
00239    int mFlags;
00240  
00241  //
00242  // private methods
00243  //
00244    // Use these two methods to copy the input tracks to mOutputWaveTracks, if 
00245    // doing the processing on them, and replacing the originals only on success (and not cancel).
00246    void CopyInputWaveTracks();
00247    
00248    // If bGoodResult, replace mWaveTracks tracks in mTracks with successfully processed 
00249    // mOutputWaveTracks copies, get rid of old mWaveTracks, and set mWaveTracks to mOutputWaveTracks. 
00250    // Else clear and delete mOutputWaveTracks copies.
00251    void ReplaceProcessedWaveTracks(const bool bGoodResult);
00252 
00253  // Used only by the base Effect class
00254  //
00255  private:
00256    void CountWaveTracks();
00257  
00258  //
00259  // private data
00260  //
00261  // Used only by the base Effect class
00262  //
00263  private:
00264 
00265    int mNumTracks; //v This is really mNumWaveTracks, per CountWaveTracks() and GetNumWaveTracks().
00266    int mNumGroups;
00267 
00268    int mID;
00269    
00270    friend class BatchCommands;// so can call PromptUser.
00271    friend class EffectManager;// so it can delete effects and access mID.
00272 
00273 };

00292    virtual bool TransferDataToWindow();
00293    virtual bool TransferDataFromWindow();

00299 };
